```{r setup, include=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
library(xts)
library(zoo)
library(lubridate)
library(dplyr)

dat<-read.csv("sales.csv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = F)
head(dat)
dat1<-read.csv("stores.csv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = F)
head(dat1)
dat2<-read.csv("products.csv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = F)
head(dat2)
dat3<-read.csv("counties.csv", header = TRUE, stringsAsFactors = F)
head(dat3,3)
datsale<-dat[,c("date","total")]
str(datsale)
datsale$date = as.Date(strptime(datsale$date, "%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S"))
class(datsale)
str(datsale)

library(forecast)
sales_ts<-ts(datsale$total, start = c(2014,1), end = c(2024,12), freq=4)

class(sales_ts)

head(sales_ts)
plot(sales_ts, bty="l")

#Subset the time series
myts2<-window(sales_ts, start=c(2018,1), end=c(2024,1))
plot(myts2)
#additional plots
monthplot(sales_ts)

# convert character data into time data
df_ts <- xts(x = datsale, order.by = datsale$date)
df_ts%>%
  na.omit()
class(df_ts)
plot.xts(df_ts$total)
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(df_ts, aes(x=date, y=total), frequency=4)
 
library(plotly)
library(hrbrthemes)
p <- df_ts %>%
  ggplot( aes(x=date, y=total)) +
    geom_area(fill="#69b3a2", alpha=0.5) +
    geom_line(color="#69b3a2") +
    ylab("bitcoin price ($)") 

# Turn it interactive with ggplotly
p <- ggplotly(p)
p

```
